intro: Heliophila bulbostyla, commonly known as the bulbous heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bulbous underground stems and erect, branching stems that bear small, clustered flowers. The plant typically blooms in the summer months, producing white or pale blue flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows or along stream banks. Heliophila bulbostyla is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
